wikipedia_page.main:
William Tayleur (10 September 1803 – 5 November 1873) was an English  Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1832 to 1835.
Tayleur was the son of John Tayleur of Buntingsdale and his wife Penelope Pearson, daughter of Thomas Pearson of Tottenhall, Staffordshire. He was Deputy Lieutenant of Shropshire and was High Sheriff of Shropshire  in 1827.At the 1832 general election Tayleur was elected Member of Parliament for Bridgwater. He held the seat until 1835.Tayleur died at the age of 70.

response: Herbert Mackworth later sold the hall to his cousin William Tayleur, who subsequently owned the property for many years. He gives his name to Tayleur Drive, the road that leads to the hall.
